repository.name: AzureStorageExplorer
repository.description: Easily manage your storage account data with Microsoft Azure Storage Explorer. Easily upload, download, and manage data from blob containers, file shares, queues, tables, and virtual machine disks. Control access and sharing through CORS rules, ACLs and more.

issue.body:
**Storage Explorer Version:** 1.11.1
**Build:** [20191206.5](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3301659)
**Branch:** dev/marayerm/electron7/packaging
**Platform/OS**: Windows 10/Linux Ubuntu 18.04
**Architecture:** ia32
**Regression From:** Previous build ([20191206.2](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3299462))

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Expand one storage account -> Blob Containers.
2. Create a new blob container -> Upload a blob to it -> Create snapshot for the blob.
3. Manage Snapshots -> Try to delete the snapshot.
4. Check the result.

**Expect Experience:**
Show a successful activity log.

**Actual Experience:**

1. Succeed to delete the blob snapshot.
2. The activity log shows 'Failed to delete...'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54055206/70424566-8e287500-1aaa-11ea-905d-b54f8bbec3b5.png)

**More Info:**
This issue doesn't reproduce on MacOS.

repository.name: AzureStorageExplorer
repository.description: Easily manage your storage account data with Microsoft Azure Storage Explorer. Easily upload, download, and manage data from blob containers, file shares, queues, tables, and virtual machine disks. Control access and sharing through CORS rules, ACLs and more.

issue.body:
**Storage Explorer Version:** 1.11.1
**Build:** [20191206.5](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3301659)
**Branch:** dev/marayerm/electron7/packaging
**Platform/OS**: Windows 10/ Linux Ubuntu 18.04/ MacOS High Sierra
**Architecture:**  ia32/x64
**Regression From:** Previous build ([20191206.2](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3299462))

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Expand one storage account -> Blob Containers -> Enable soft delete policy.
2. Create a new blob container -> Upload a blob to it -> Delete the blob.
3. Right click the deleted blob -> **Undelete** -> **Undelete Selected**.
4. Observe the activity log in Activities for minutes.

**Expect Experience:**
The activity log shows well.

**Actual Experience:**
The activity log changed.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54055206/70430184-2fb4c400-1ab5-11ea-8703-f9ff2f601494.png)


**More Info:**
This issue doesn't reproduce for '**undelete by date...**'.

repository.name: AzureStorageExplorer
repository.description: Easily manage your storage account data with Microsoft Azure Storage Explorer. Easily upload, download, and manage data from blob containers, file shares, queues, tables, and virtual machine disks. Control access and sharing through CORS rules, ACLs and more.

issue.body:
**Storage Explorer Version:** 1.11.1
**Build:** [20191204.2](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3292206)
**Branch:** master
**Platform/OS:** Windows 10/ Linux Ubuntu 18.04/macOS High Sierra
**Architecture:** ia32/x64
**Regression From:** Not a regression

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Give an RBAC role to a user like 'Blob Data Owner Role' on one blob container tier.
2. Attach the blob container with Azure AD.
3. Open one blob -> Edit this blob and close it -> Select 'Snapshot original blob then upload' on File Changes Detected dialog.
4. Check the result.

**Expect Experience:**
Succeed to create snapshot.

**Actual Experience:**
Fail to create snapshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54055206/70131461-52159e80-16bd-11ea-9f1b-bd47693ef601.png)

repository.name: AzureStorageExplorer

issue.body:
**Storage Explorer Version:** 1.11.1
**Build:** [20191206.5](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3301659)
**Branch:** dev/marayerm/electron7/packaging
**Platform/OS:** Windows 10/ Linux Ubuntu 18.04/ MacOS High Sierra
**Emulator**: 5.10.0.0
**Architecture:** ia32/x64
**Regression From:** Previous build ([20191206.2](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3299462))

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Make sure Storage Emulator(5.10.0.0) is started.
2. Expand 'Local & Attached' -> 'Storage Accounts' -> '(Emulator - Default Ports)(Key)' -> 'Blob Containers'.
3. Create a new blob container -> Upload a blob to it -> Try to delete the blob.
4. Check the result.

**Expect Experience:**
Show a successful activity log.

**Actual Experience:**

1. Succeed to delete the blob.
2. The activity log shows 'Failed to delete...'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54055206/70519570-1ecc8700-1b77-11ea-8d9b-c3ce7303cab7.png)

body: @MRayermannMSFT no, i actually seriously appreciate all the info! i'll try to tackle this. For some context on our side: `child_process.fork` runs by design in `ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE` mode. The errors present are likely the result of a schism between real Node.js and Electron's mode that runs to emulate the Node.js executable in a way that breaks timers.

Hey @codebytere , do you have any thoughts on when y'all might be getting to this? Also, I tried disabling/enabling `ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE` and neither mode fixed the issue (assuming I did it correctly). I can double check again later today.

EDIT: after double checking, it doesn't look like Electron is letting me change the value of ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE.
@codebytere Do you have any update to share? This issue is the only blocking issue to us upgrading to Electron 7, which will fix a lot of our own bugs, and we'd _really_ like to do that.
i can try to get to this soon - i see from above though that there are some potential workarounds, though. Do none of those work enough to unblock this?

I don't have any breaking news on this, but to report in for completeness:

I did a little poking around on this yesterday to track down when this broke, in the hopes that it might be something simple. Unfortunately, the breakpoint is exactly what one would've expected -- the repro exits prematurely in 3ddd917ff4564cd304065ff3a1a7509fa953b7c7 (Dec 4 2018) but works fine in 83d951db7e924377ffdd4968cd34b274931e8a3d (Nov 30 2018) -- that is, it broke when we upgraded to 70.0.3538.110 for Electron 5, most likely with the node bump in 0adbcfd8067d57c0466a2ed47149e568bd2eded7

> For some context on our side: child_process.fork runs by design in ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE mode.

Agreed! As long as we're using ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE, we don't even need child_process.fork().

```sh
$ ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE=1 electron awaitPromise.js
```

Is enough to trigger the bug, leaving `main.js` out of it entirely.

As a baseline,

```sh
$ node awaitPromise.js
```

works correctly.
@ckerr Is there a way to disable ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE for a child process? I wasn't able to do it, but maybe I was just doing it wrong?
